meanings.definition: (adjective) characteristic of a person who is drunk or intoxicated
meanings.sent1: After a few drinks, he became jakey and started singing loudly.
meanings.sent2: The jakey man stumbled out of the bar, struggling to walk straight.
meanings.sent3: The jakey fellow tried to dance on the table but ended up tripping over his own feet.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, sounding jakey like a tipsy song.
meanings.sent5: The room was filled with the jakey scent of spilled beer and whiskey.

meanings.definition: (noun) a person who is often drunk or intoxicated
meanings.sent1: The jakey at the party was the center of attention with his wild antics.
meanings.sent2: The bartender refused to serve the known jakey any more alcohol.
meanings.sent3: Everyone knew him as the jakey who could never resist a drink.
meanings.sent4: In a sea of sober faces, he stood out like a jakey lighthouse on a dark night.
meanings.sent5: The town's local jakey was a regular at the pub, always with a drink in hand.
